How to Install geoclue-manual on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • geoclue-manual

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install geoclue-manual on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing geoclue-manual on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall geoclue-manual in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install geoclue-manual, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install geoclue-manual Using apt

To install geoclue-manual in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install geoclue-manual using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install geoclue-manual

The installation of geoclue-manual might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install geoclue-manual Using apt-get

To install geoclue-manual using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install geoclue-manual.

sudo apt-get -y install geoclue-manual

Install geoclue-manual Using Synaptic

To install geoclue-manual using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install geoclue-manual on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for geoclue-manual. This will display the geoclue-manual package in the package window, now to install geoclue-manual, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the geoclue-manual package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of geoclue-manual.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install geoclue-manual Using aptitude

To install geoclue-manual on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of geoclue-manual.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install geoclue-manual using the command aptitude install geoclue-manual.

sudo aptitude -y install geoclue-manual

How to Upgrade geoclue-manual on debian

If you want to upgrade the geoclue-manual package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade geoclue-manual using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade geoclue-manual to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade geoclue-manual.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade geoclue-manual sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade geoclue-manual

Upgrade geoclue-manual using Aptitude

To upgrade geoclue-manual using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade geoclue-manual.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade geoclue-manual

Upgrade geoclue-manual using Synaptic

To upgrade geoclue-manual using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for geoclue-manual, now right-click geoclue-manual, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade geoclue-manual just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall geoclue-manual on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall geoclue-manual from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just geoclue-manual, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove geoclue-manual

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of geoclue-manual

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of geoclue-manual you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge geoclue-manual

Remove geoclue-manual using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall geoclue-manual using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for geoclue-manual, right-click the geoclue-manual package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall geoclue-manual click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install geoclue-manual on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade geoclue-manual using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of geoclue-manual then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
